main event: A UFO sighting was reported near Mitchell Field, L.I., New York on 4 November 1957 at 0525 GMT. The observation, made by military personnel using ground radar, lasted for 15 minutes and involved the sighting of one round yellow object flying in a circle. No photographs were taken.
interesting points: The observation was made by military personnel using ground radar, adding credibility to the report.
The UFO was described as a steady yellow light and it was still in sight after the observation period when visually lost.
The conclusion was that the description, duration, and flight path were probably caused by a balloon.
The sighting took place at night with scattered 5 miles visibility and weather conditions were recorded.
The UFO was not visible to the control tower operator at Mitchel Air Force Base, and the observer insisted that it was not an aircraft.
result: prosaic explanation - likely caused by a balloon, according to the conclusion drawn in the report
sighted object: one round yellow object flying in a circle
